body: Does this work with positive X coordinates? And are you capable of pinpointing which commit broke this?

Yes, positive values work as expected. No idea about the commit, don't follow the development that closely.

To paint the picture a bit better, this is my setup:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/538801/89111803-62536880-d45a-11ea-87a6-471bd70a8495.png)

Number **2** is primary, so 0x0 coordinates are in its left top corner, and I'm trying to use `x: -1920` to place the window to the left edge of the monitor **1**.

> No idea about the commit, don't follow the development that closely.

Can you share the version? Did it work correctly in 0.4.3?

issue.title: On Windows, `set_outer_position` does not accept negative coordinates anymore

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body: This has been reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/4061.

body:
This looks like an Alacritty bug, not a Winit bug. Alacritty's `set_outer_position` wrapper takes a `PhysicalPosition<u32>` instead of a `PhysicalPosition<i32>`, which discards any negative coordinates:

https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/blob/9167461eb35687872a7670b2e7105a56244f7a48/alacritty/src/window.rs#L337-L339

Winit's `set_outer_position` function is generic over the position type, so if Alacritty passes it a type with negative numbers it should handle them fine.

You're absolutely right. Though this means that it **did not** work in 0.4.3 and was not introduced recently.

Thanks for spotting that @Osspial.

issue.title: Fix negative window position
issue.body:
This resolves an issue where negative window positions set in the
configuration file would not place the Alacritty window in the correct
location.

Fixes #4061.

body: This should be fixed in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/4067 @darsain, please test this if you're able.
